business.headline: Infosys employees get 5-8% salary hikes, lower than before: ReportThe IT firm sent salary revision letters to employees, offering hikes between 5% and 8% for most, depending on their performance rating.
Failed to deposit TDS? Tax officials may be knocking soonAround 40,000 taxpayers are under scrutiny for potential defaults in tax deductions for the financial years 2022-23 and 2023-24.

Applying for personal loan? 5 hidden charges you must check While banks may not disclose the hidden charges when applying for personal loans, borrowers must understand them when applying for the same.
FD rates dip: Check IndusInd, DCB, City Union and other top banksWith a drop in FD interest rates, depositors might witness a marginal decline in their earnings on fixed deposits.

Chairman says allegations are false: Jubilant FoodWorks after reports of FIRIn a stock exchange filing, Jubilant FoodWorks said its Chairman Shyam Sundar Bhartia has denied all allegations against him, calling them "baseless, false and disparaging, and made with clear malafide intent".

Sensex gains, Nifty loses: Markets stay range-bound as cautious sentiment prevailsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 147.71 points to close at 74,602.12, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 5.80 points to end at 22,547.55.

RBI withdrawal relief for New India Co-op Bank depositors. Check details hereThis announcement comes just over a week after the central bank prohibited the bank from issuing new loans, dissolved its board and took control owing to 'supervisory concerns.'

Sell India, Buy China: Why FIIs are falling out of love with Dalal StreetDalal Street has witnessed correction over the past six months, with the Nifty50 plummeting from 25,200 levels to around 22,500 levels by the end of February 2025.

Reliance bets big on Assam, to invest Rs 50,000 crore in next 5 yearsManaging Director Mukesh Ambani announced an investment of Rs 50,000 crore in Assam. A major part of Reliance's investment will be directed towards making Assam a leader in technology and artificial intelligence (AI).
Hungary announces tax exemption for mothers with 2 or more children The said announcement comes ahead of the 2026 elections and is a part of Orban's efforts to boost the country's birth rate.

DBS set to cut 4,000 jobs over 3 years due to AI, says CEODBS CEO Piyush Gupta said the bank will shrink its workforce by 10% in the next three years due to artificial intelligence replacing human roles.

Hein Schumacher to step down as Unilever CEO in MarchThe departure comes just weeks after Unilever announced underwhelming full-year earnings and chose Amsterdam over London and New York as the primary listing for its ice cream business.

entertainment.headline: Singer Udit Narayan visits Maha Kumbh Mela with wife, expresses gratitude Singer Udit Narayan was among the latest celebrities to visit the holy city of Prayagraj for Maha Kumbh 2025. In an interview with ANI, he expressed his gratitude and congratulated Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath for the well-organised and efficient arrangements.

My Dearest Nemesis review: Chaotic chemistry makes even familiar trope workMy Dearest Nemesis features K-drama stars Moon Ga young and Choi Hyun-wook in the lead. It is available to stream on Viki. Here's our take on the romantic drama.

Internet calls Farah Khan 'insensitive' for mocking Gaurav Khanna's colour blindnessCelebrity MasterChef judge Farah Khan mocked TV actor Gaurav Khanna's colour blindness on the show. Following the same, the internet is outraged by her comments, criticising the filmmaker and calling her 'insensitive'.

Parineeti Chopra gears up for her first Netflix yet-to-be-titled thriller seriesActor Parineeti Chopra is set to make her series OTT debut with a Netflix project. The actor shared a post and informed about sharing screen space with Nimrit Kaur, Soni Razdan, and others.

Tanmay Bhat's X account hacked, comedian warns followersTanmay Bhat's X account recently got hacked, leading to fraudulent messages being posted online. The comedian shared a post on his Instagram and warned his followers.

Prajakta Koli-Vrishank Khanal can't take their eyes off each other in haldi picsActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry longtime boyfriend Vrishank Khanan on February 25. Ahead of the grand day, the actor shared pictures from her haldi function.

Anupam Mittal on India's Got Latent backlash: Not a lost episode of Satyamev JayateAnupam Mittal weighs in on the India's Got Latent row, arguing that YouTube should also be held accountable. He calls Big Tech the real culprit, criticising digital platforms for fueling outrage-driven content.

Bobby Deol says Aashram helped him break industry image, explore new rolesActor Bobby Deol is all set to return as Baba Nirala in Prakash Jha's series, Aashram 3 part 2. The actor confessed that he wanted to step out of his comfort zone.

Waking of Nation trailer: Taaruk Raina fights to prove Jallianwala Bagh was plannedA new show that explores the events surrounding the Jallianwala Bagh massacre is set to premiere on Sony LIV on March 8. Starring Taaruk Raina in the lead role, the series is titled The Waking of a Nation.
Singer Justin Bieber responds to rumours of drug useJustin Bieber's representative has reacted to the reports of the singer's drug use and called them false.

Ranveer Allahbadia runs to car after recording statement in Latent probeRanveer Allahbadia was clicked in a hurried state, running towards his car as the paparazzi tried to capture his pictures on Monday. The YouTuber visited the Maharashtra Cyber office in Mahape after recording his statement.

Kaushaljis vs Kaushal review: A simple yet complex tale of second chance in loveReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Kaushaljis vs Kaushal movie review: This film is a heartfelt exploration of second chances in love, focusing on a middle-aged couple navigating the complexities of separation and familial expectations. Set in the relatable backdrop of Kannauj, the film captivates with its simplicity and stellar performances.

general news.headline: Army guns down Pakistani intruder, foils infiltration bid in Punjab's PathankotAlert BSF troops foiled an infiltration attempt in Pathankot on February 26. Officials said personnel at BOP Tashpatan detected suspicious movement and spotted an intruder trying to cross into India.

Maha Kumbh marks grand culmination today, devotees flock for final Amrit SnanThe Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj, which attracted 65 crore devotees from across the country, is set to conclude on Wednesday, coinciding with Mahashivratri.

Bihar Cabinet expansion likely today, 5 BJP MLAs may join: SourcesThe current strength of the Bihar Cabinet is 30, with 15 BJP ministers, 13 JD(U), one from the Hindustani Awam Morcha (HAM) and an Independent. Six seats remain vacant.

Over 100 Pakistani policemen dismissed for refusing Champions Trophy dutyIn an unprecedented move, over 100 Punjab Police officers were dismissed for refusing security duties during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, as authorities emphasised zero tolerance for negligence in safeguarding international sporting events.

Why Thailand's Koh Samui is gaining popularity among IndiansKoh Samui is known for its beautiful beaches, temples like Wat Phra Yai (Big Buddha Temple), and natural attractions such as Hin Ta and Hin Yai Rocks.

What Ranveer Allahbadia told cops over India's Got Latent rowRanveer Allahbadia is under investigation by Maharashtra Cyber and Mumbai police for comments made on comedian Samay Raina's show India's Got Latent.

What is Trump's Gold Card for immigrants, $5 million 'pathway to US citizenship'?US President Donald Trump has introduced the 'Gold Card', a $5 million pathway to US citizenship for wealthy foreign investors, calling it a "premium" Green Card.

Conman Sukesh writes to 'my man' Elon Musk, offers to invest $2 billion in XJailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekar has written to Elon Musk, calling him "my man" and offering to invest $2 billion in X. From Delhi's Mandoli jail, he also congratulated Musk on leading the US government's new Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

England greats accuse ICC of favouritism: India playing in Dubai an 'advantage'Former England cricketers Nasser Hussain and Michael Atherton believe India has a major advantage in the Champions Trophy by playing all their matches in Dubai, avoiding travel fatigue while other teams shuttle between Pakistan and the UAE.

White House says Amy Gleason, not Elon Musk, is heading Trump's DOGEGleason, also a former official at the US Digital Service, served in the first Trump administration. After Trump's Jan. 20 inauguration, the Digital Service was renamed DOGE and is radically downsizing the federal government, including thousands of job cuts.

Video: US flight aborts landing at last minute to avoid collision with jetThe quick response by the pilots of a Southwest Airlines flight avoided a catastrophic collision at Chicago Midway International Airport, when an unauthorised business jet entered the runway.

Watch: Virat Kohli fans in Pakistan root for India after home team's exit Champions Trophy: A section of Pakistan cricket fans, speaking to India Today in Lahore, said they were rooting for India to win the tournament. The Men in Blue beat Pakistan by six wickets in their second Group A fixture, which put them on the verge of being knocked out. They faced the exit after New Zealand's commanding win over Bangladesh.

When Govinda broke engagement with Sunita Ahuja, wanted to marry Neelam KothariGovinda had once shared that he 'lost his heart' to co-star Neelam Kothari, and even broke his engagement with Sunita Ahuja. Despite his deep affection for Neelam, he eventually married Sunita, admittedly driven by a sense of duty rather than love.

Why Modi govt isn't fascist, explains CPM, rattles Congress and CPIIn a draft note ahead of its party congress in April, the CPM has explained that while the Modi government exhibits "neo-fascist characteristics", it does not qualify as a "fascist or a neo-fascist regime". This stance has triggered sharp criticism from its national allies, the CPI and the Congress.

Stalin says Tamil Nadu ready for 'language war', Annamalai fires backTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin reiterated his stance on the language debate, asserting that the state is "ready for another language war" amid renewed tensions over the Centre's alleged Hindi imposition.

Preity Zinta reflects on life and attachment after third Maha Kumbh visitPreity Zinta visited Maha Kumbh with her mother and reflected on life, attachment, and spirituality. This was her third visit to Maha Kumbh Mela which is set to conclude later today.

Actor Prajakta Koli marries her longtime boyfriend Vrishank KhanalYouTuber-turned-actor Prajakta Koli is now married to her longtime boyfriend and lawyer Vrishank Khanal. On February 25, the Mismatched actor shared dreamy pictures from her wedding ceremony.

Looted Delhi: BJP hits out at AAP after CAG report flags Rs 2,000 crore lossArvind Kejriwal acted as a "middleman for the liquor lobby", Delhi BJP president Virendra Sachdeva alleged after a CAG report tabled in the Assembly said there was a cumulative loss of over Rs 2,000 crore due to the 2021-2022 excise policy.

US, Ukraine agree to critical minerals deal amid talks to end Russia warThe US and Ukraine have finalised a minerals deal, hoping to improve ties, as Kyiv agreed to joint resource development after the US reportedly dropped its $500 billion revenue demand.

Champions Trophy: Dysfunctional Pakistan need counselling, not surgeryPakistan team's horror run in the recent ICC tournaments keeps bringing up some similar patterns. Unfortunately, the country's cricketing ecosystem has turned a blind eye to all of them.

Thalapathy Vijay's son Jason Sanjay makes rare public appearance at weddingActor-politician Thalapathy Vijay's son, Jason Sanjay, attended PMK's (Pattali Makkal Katchi) honorary president GK Mani's grandson's wedding reception. This rare public appearance comes ahead of his directorial debut.

Rahul Bose was denied a chair on set: Producer's uncle, sister had one, but not meActor Rahul Bose recalls being denied a chair on his first film set, while everyone else had one. The experience led him to always bring his own chair to sets. He will next be seen in Metro... In Dino.

Shivratri every month, Maha Shivratri once a year – know whyShivratri is observed every month on the 14th lunar day, dedicated to Lord Shiva, while Maha Shivratri, celebrated once a year, holds special significance as it marks the divine union of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. Here's a detailed explanation of both these auspicious occasions.

Watch: SRK's son AbRam singing, playing guitar will make you 'Die With a Smile'A video showcasing AbRam Khan's impressive guitar skills is going live. It is from a school event, where he sang 'Die With A Smile'.

Watch: SRK's son AbRam singing, playing guitar will make you 'Die With a Smile'A video showcasing AbRam Khan's impressive guitar skills is going live. It is from a school event, where he sang 'Die With A Smile'.

Chhaava box office Day 12: Vicky Kaushal film maintains pace, eyes Rs 400 croreVicky Kaushal's film Chhaava is dominating the domestic box office, rapidly nearing the Rs 400 crore milestone after crossing Rs 350 crore. The film is maintaining its pace steadily.

Sandeep Vanga: A big production house rejected actor because he acted in Kabir SinghDirector Sandeep Reddy Vanga slammed a big Bollywood production house for not casting a supporting actor citing the reason that he worked in Kabir Singh. He expressed his frustration at the unfair treatment.

sports.headline: Is the WPL getting enough love amid Champions Trophy festival? The Champions Trophy and the Women's Premier League are happening simultaneously. But with stars like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in action in Dubai, is the WPL getting enough attention?

England captain on boycott calls: Saddened by Afghan women's plight, but sport unitesEngland captain Jos Buttler backed the ECB's decision to play Afghanistan in the Champions Trophy despite boycott calls, expressing concern for Afghan women but hoping sport can unite. Afghanistan captain Hashmatullah Shahidi distanced cricket from politics, while the Taliban's restrictions on women's sport remain under scrutiny.

Security breach disrupts Champions Trophy in PakistanA security breach at Pakistan's Champions Trophy involved an intruder approaching cricketer Rachin Ravindra. The intruder, linked to an Islamist political group, has been banned by the Cricket Board.

Steve Smith, Rashid Khan to star in The Hundred, Ben Stokes pulls outSteve Smith and Rashid Khan secured The Hundred deals, while England's Ben Stokes opted out to manage his workload. The tournament also saw major signings, including Trent Boult, Marcus Stoinis, Meg Lanning, and Laura Wolvaardt.

Over 100 Pakistani policemen dismissed for refusing Champions Trophy dutyIn an unprecedented move, over 100 Punjab Police officers were dismissed for refusing security duties during the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, as authorities emphasised zero tolerance for negligence in safeguarding international sporting events.

Clash of Champions: How much money are teams earning in Champions Trophy?The Champions Trophy has already delivered high-stakes drama, with hosts Pakistan crashing out alongside Bangladesh. However, every team, including those eliminated in the group stage, is set to receive financial rewards. Here's a breakdown of the prize money distribution for the tournament.

On Wednesday, Rawalpindi saw the tournamen's first washed-off match between Australia and South Africa.

Pakistan Cricket Board beefs up ground security after pitch invasion in RawalpindiThe Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has reinforced the security at all the venues of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 after a pitch invasion by a fan during the New Zealand vs Bangladesh match in Rawalpindi.

JButtler takes a dig at India for only playing in Dubai: It's a unique tournamentEngland captain Jos Buttler commented on India's advantage of playing at just one venue in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. The Men in Blue are playing all of their matches in Dubai after denying to travel to Pakistan for the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
